item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, February 25, 2025 at 1:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Claude 3.7 Sonnet and Claude Code (1232 points | 561 comments)
2. "The closer to the train station, the worse the kebab" – a "study" (166 points | 163 comments)
3. It's still worth blogging in the age of AI (18 points | discuss)
4. Show HN: I built an app to stop me doomscrolling by touching grass (949 points | 239 comments)

7. I ate and reviewed every snack in our office kitchen (55 points | 26 comments)

9. The best way to use text embeddings portably is with Parquet and Polars (125 points | 34 comments)
10. Breaking into apartment buildings in five minutes on my phone (272 points | 169 comments)

13. Neut Programming Language (118 points | 30 comments)

15. AI cracks superbug problem in two days that took scientists years (170 points | 86 comments)
16. Microsoft cancels leases for AI data centers, analyst says (316 points | 264 comments)
17. Modular forms, the 'fifth fundamental operation' of math (2023) (54 points | 2 comments)
18. Right to Repair laws have now been introduced in all 50 us states (377 points | 113 comments)
19. Show HN: Electro – A hyper-fast Windows image viewer with a built-in terminal (31 points | 16 comments)
20. Show HN: I made a site to tell the time in corporate (171 points | 87 comments)
21. US asked to kick UK out of Five Eyes (21 points | 7 comments)
22. Ashby (YC W19) Is Hiring Principal Product Engineers ( | hide)
23. Keeping our free tier sustainable by preventing abuse (50 points | 21 comments)

25. Student refines 100-year-old math problem, expanding wind energy possibilities (89 points | 9 comments)
26. Is this the simplest (and most surprising) sorting algorithm ever? (2021) (88 points | 90 comments)
27. Vialess heterogeneous skin patch for multimodal monitoring and stimulation (7 points | discuss)
28. Apple says it will add 20k jobs, spend $500B, produce AI servers in US (518 points | 502 comments)
29. Why does target="_blank" have an underscore in front? (2024) (244 points | 176 comments)
30. Show HN: Bracket City – A daily, exploded (?) crossword puzzle (75 points | 36 comments)
